that his voice should no more be heard
    on the mountains of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your mother was like a vine in a vineyard
    planted by the water,
fruitful and full of branches
    by reason of abundant water.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now it is planted in the wilderness,
    in a dry and thirsty land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And fire has gone out from the stem of its shoots,
    has consumed its fruit,
so that there remains in it no strong stem,
    no scepter for ruling.
This is a lamentation and has become a lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the seventh year, in the fifth month, on the tenth day of the month, certain of the elders of Israel came to inquire of the Lord, and sat before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel, and say to them, Thus says the Lord God, Is it to inquire of me that you come? As I live, declares the Lord God, I will not be inquired of by you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Will you judge them, son of man, will you judge them? Let them know the abominations of their fathers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to them, Thus says the Lord God: On the day when I chose Israel, I swore to the offspring of the house of Jacob, making myself known to them in the land of Egypt; I swore to them, saying, I am the Lord your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day I swore to them that I would bring them out of the land of Egypt into a land that I had searched out for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, the most glorious of all lands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I said to them, ‘Cast away the detestable things your eyes feast on, every one of you, and do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt; I am the Lord your God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they rebelled against me and were not willing to listen to me. None of them cast away the detestable things their eyes feasted on, nor did they forsake the idols of Egypt.
“Then I said I would pour out my wrath upon them and spend my anger against them in the midst of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I acted for the sake of my name, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations among whom they lived, in whose sight I made myself known to them in bringing them out of the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I led them out of the land of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I gave them my statutes and made known to them my rules, by which, if a person does them, he shall live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I gave them my Sabbaths, as a sign between me and them, that they might know that I am the Lord who sanctifies them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness. They did not walk in my statutes but rejected my rules, by which, if a person does them, he shall live; and my Sabbaths they greatly profaned.
“Then I said I would pour out my wrath upon them in the wilderness, to make a full end of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I acted for the sake of my name, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I had brought them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would not bring them into the land that I had given them, a land flowing with milk and honey, the most glorious of all lands,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they rejected my rules and did not walk in my statutes, and profaned my Sabbaths; for their heart went after their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, my eye spared them, and I did not destroy them or make a full end of them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I said to their children in the wilderness, ‘Do not walk in the statutes of your fathers, nor keep their rules, nor defile yourselves with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord your God; walk in my statutes, and be careful to obey my rules,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and keep my Sabbaths holy that they may be a sign between me and you, that you may know that I am the Lord your God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the children rebelled against me. They did not walk in my statutes and were not careful to obey my rules, by which, if a person does them, he shall live; they profaned my Sabbaths.
“Then I said I would pour out my wrath upon them and spend my anger against them in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I withheld my hand and acted for the sake of my name, that it should not be profaned in the sight of the nations, in whose sight I had brought them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I swore to them in the wilderness that I would scatter them among the nations and disperse them through the countries,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because they had not obeyed my rules, but had rejected my statutes and profaned my Sabbaths, and their eyes were set on their fathers' idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, I gave them statutes that were not good and rules by which they could not have life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I defiled them through their very gifts in their offering up all their firstborn, that I might devastate them. I did it that they might know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, son of man, speak to the house of Israel and say to them, Thus says the Lord God: In this also your fathers blasphemed me, by dealing treacherously with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when I had brought them into the land that I swore to give them, then wherever they saw any high hill or any leafy tree, there they offered their sacrifices and there they presented the provocation of their offering; there they sent up their pleasing aromas, and there they poured out their drink offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (I said to them, ‘What is the high place to which you go?’ So its name is called Bamah to this day.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore say to the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord God: Will you defile yourselves after the manner of your fathers and go whoring after their detestable things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you present your gifts and offer up your children in fire, you defile yourselves with all your idols to this day. And shall I be inquired of by you, O house of Israel? As I live, declares the Lord God, I will not be inquired of by you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What is in your mind shall never happen—the thought, ‘Let us be like the nations, like the tribes of the countries, and worship wood and stone.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As I live, declares the Lord God, surely with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and with wrath poured out I will be king over you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring you out from the peoples and gather you out of the countries where you are scattered, with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, and with wrath poured out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring you into the wilderness of the peoples, and there I will enter into judgment with you face to face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I entered into judgment with your fathers in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so I will enter into judgment with you, declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you pass under the rod, and I will bring you into the bond of the covenant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will purge out the rebels from among you, and those who transgress against me. I will bring them out of the land where they sojourn, but they shall not enter the land of Israel. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, O house of Israel, thus says the Lord God: Go serve every one of you his idols, now and hereafter, if you will not listen to me; but my holy name you shall no more profane with your gifts and your idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For on my holy mountain, the mountain height of Israel, declares the Lord God, there all the house of Israel, all of them, shall serve me in the land. There I will accept them, and there I will require your contributions and the choicest of your gifts, with all your sacred offerings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a pleasing aroma I will accept you, when I bring you out from the peoples and gather you out of the countries where you have been scattered. And I will manifest my holiness among you in the sight of the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall know that I am the Lord, when I bring you into the land of Israel, the country that I swore to give to your fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there you shall remember your ways and all your deeds with which you have defiled yourselves, and you shall loathe yourselves for all the evils that you have committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall know that I am the Lord, when I deal with you for my name's sake, not according to your evil ways, nor according to your corrupt deeds, O house of Israel, declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward the southland; preach against the south, and prophesy against the forest land in the Negeb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to the forest of the Negeb, Hear the word of the Lord: Thus says the Lord God, Behold, I will kindle a fire in you, and it shall devour every green tree in you and every dry tree. The blazing flame shall not be quenched, and all faces from south to north shall be scorched by it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All flesh shall see that I the Lord have kindled it; it shall not be quenched.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said, “Ah, Lord God! They are saying of me, ‘Is he not a maker of parables?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward Jerusalem and preach against the sanctuaries. Prophesy against the land of Israel
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and say to the land of Israel, Thus says the Lord: Behold, I am against you and will draw my sword from its sheath and will cut off from you both righteous and wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I will cut off from you both righteous and wicked, therefore my sword shall be drawn from its sheath against all flesh from south to north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And all flesh shall know that I am the Lord. I have drawn my sword from its sheath; it shall not be sheathed again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, groan; with breaking heart and bitter grief, groan before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they say to you, ‘Why do you groan?’ you shall say, ‘Because of the news that it is coming. Every heart will melt, and all hands will be feeble; every spirit will faint, and all knees will be weak as water. Behold, it is coming, and it will be fulfilled,’” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, prophesy and say, Thus says the Lord, say:
“A sword, a sword is sharpened
    and also polished,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
sharpened for slaughter,
    polished to flash like lightning!
(Or shall we rejoice? You have despised the rod, my son, with everything of wood.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sword is given to be polished, that it may be grasped in the hand. It is sharpened and polished to be given into the hand of the slayer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cry out and wail, son of man, for it is against my people. It is against all the princes of Israel. They are delivered over to the sword with my people. Strike therefore upon your thigh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it will not be a testing—what could it do if you despise the rod?” declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, prophesy. Clap your hands and let the sword come down twice, yes, three times, the sword for those to be slain. It is the sword for the great slaughter, which surrounds them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that their hearts may melt, and many stumble. At all their gates I have given the glittering sword. Ah, it is made like lightning; it is taken up for slaughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cut sharply to the right; set yourself to the left, wherever your face is directed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I also will clap my hands, and I will satisfy my fury; I the Lord have spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me again:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, mark two ways for the sword of the king of Babylon to come. Both of them shall come from the same land. And make a signpost; make it at the head of the way to a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mark a way for the sword to come to Rabbah of the Ammonites and to Judah, into Jerusalem the fortified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the king of Babylon stands at the parting of the way, at the head of the two ways, to use divination. He shakes the arrows; he consults the teraphim; he looks at the liver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Into his right hand comes the divination for Jerusalem, to set battering rams, to open the mouth with murder, to lift up the voice with shouting, to set battering rams against the gates, to cast up mounds, to build siege towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to them it will seem like a false divination. They have sworn solemn oaths, but he brings their guilt to remembrance, that they may be taken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord God: Because you have made your guilt to be remembered, in that your transgressions are uncovered, so that in all your deeds your sins appear—because you have come to remembrance, you shall be taken in hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you, O profane wicked one, prince of Israel, whose day has come, the time of your final punishment,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: thus says the Lord God: Remove the turban and take off the crown. Things shall not remain as they are. Exalt that which is low, and bring low that which is exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A ruin, ruin, ruin I will make it. This also shall not be, until he comes, the one to whom judgment belongs, and I will give it to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus says the Lord God concerning the Ammonites and concerning their reproach; say, A sword, a sword is drawn for the slaughter. It is polished to consume and to flash like lightning—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while they see for you false visions, while they divine lies for you—to place you on the necks of the profane wicked, whose day has come, the time of their final punishment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Return it to its sheath. In the place where you were created, in the land of your origin, I will judge you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will pour out my indignation upon you; I will blow upon you with the fire of my wrath, and I will deliver you into the hands of brutish men, skillful to destroy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall be fuel for the fire. Your blood shall be in the midst of the land. You shall be no more remembered, for I the Lord have spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the bloody city? Then declare to her all her abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You shall say, Thus says the Lord God: A city that sheds blood in her midst, so that her time may come, and that makes idols to defile herself!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have become guilty by the blood that you have shed, and defiled by the idols that you have made, and you have brought your days near, the appointed time of your years has come. Therefore I have made you a reproach to the nations, and a mockery to all the countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who are near and those who are far from you will mock you; your name is defiled; you are full of tumult.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, the princes of Israel in you, every one according to his power, have been bent on shedding blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Father and mother are treated with contempt in you; the sojourner suffers extortion in your midst; the fatherless and the widow are wronged in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have despised my holy things and profaned my Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are men in you who slander to shed blood, and people in you who eat on the mountains; they commit lewdness in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In you men uncover their fathers' nakedness; in you they violate women who are unclean in their menstrual impurity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One commits abomination with his neighbor's wife; another lewdly defiles his daughter-in-law; another in you violates his sister, his father's daughter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In you they take bribes to shed blood; you take interest and profit and make gain of your neighbors by extortion; but me you have forgotten, declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Behold, I strike my hand at the dishonest gain that you have made, and at the blood that has been in your midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Can your courage endure, or can your hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with you? I the Lord have spoken, and I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter you among the nations and disperse you through the countries, and I will consume your uncleanness out of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall be profaned by your own doing in the sight of the nations, and you shall know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, the house of Israel has become dross to me; all of them are bronze and tin and iron and lead in the furnace; they are dross of silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Because you have all become dross, therefore, behold, I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As one gathers silver and bronze and iron and lead and tin into a furnace, to blow the fire on it in order to melt it, so I will gather you in my anger and in my wrath, and I will put you in and melt you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will gather you and blow on you with the fire of my wrath, and you shall be melted in the midst of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As silver is melted in a furnace, so you shall be melted in the midst of it, and you shall know that I am the Lord; I have poured out my wrath upon you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, say to her, You are a land that is not cleansed or rained upon in the day of indignation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The conspiracy of her prophets in her midst is like a roaring lion tearing the prey; they have devoured human lives; they have taken treasure and precious things; they have made many widows in her midst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her priests have done violence to my law and have profaned my holy things. They have made no distinction between the holy and the common, neither have they taught the difference between the unclean and the clean, and they have disregarded my Sabbaths, so that I am profaned among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Her princes in her midst are like wolves tearing the prey, shedding blood, destroying lives to get dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And her prophets have smeared whitewash for them, seeing false visions and divining lies for them, saying, ‘Thus says the Lord God,’ when the Lord has not spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people of the land have practiced extortion and committed robbery. They have oppressed the poor and needy, and have extorted from the sojourner without justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I sought for a man among them who should build up the wall and stand in the breach before me for the land, that I should not destroy it, but I found none.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I have poured out my indignation upon them. I have consumed them with the fire of my wrath. I have returned their way upon their heads, declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, there were two women, the daughters of one mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They played the whore in Egypt; they played the whore in their youth; there their breasts were pressed and their virgin bosoms handled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Oholah was the name of the elder and Oholibah the name of her sister. They became mine, and they bore sons and daughters. As for their names, Oholah is Samaria, and Oholibah is Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Oholah played the whore while she was mine, and she lusted after her lovers the Assyrians, warriors
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: clothed in purple, governors and commanders, all of them desirable young men, horsemen riding on horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She bestowed her whoring upon them, the choicest men of Assyria all of them, and she defiled herself with all the idols of everyone after whom she lusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She did not give up her whoring that she had begun in Egypt; for in her youth men had lain with her and handled her virgin bosom and poured out their whoring lust upon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore I delivered her into the hands of her lovers, into the hands of the Assyrians, after whom she lusted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These uncovered her nakedness; they seized her sons and her daughters; and as for her, they killed her with the sword; and she became a byword among women, when judgment had been executed on her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Her sister Oholibah saw this, and she became more corrupt than her sister in her lust and in her whoring, which was worse than that of her sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She lusted after the Assyrians, governors and commanders, warriors clothed in full armor, horsemen riding on horses, all of them desirable young men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I saw that she was defiled; they both took the same way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But she carried her whoring further. She saw men portrayed on the wall, the images of the Chaldeans portrayed in vermilion,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: wearing belts on their waists, with flowing turbans on their heads, all of them having the appearance of officers, a likeness of Babylonians whose native land was Chaldea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she saw them, she lusted after them and sent messengers to them in Chaldea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Babylonians came to her into the bed of love, and they defiled her with their whoring lust. And after she was defiled by them, she turned from them in disgust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she carried on her whoring so openly and flaunted her nakedness, I turned in disgust from her, as I had turned in disgust from her sister.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet she increased her whoring, remembering the days of her youth, when she played the whore in the land of Egypt
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and lusted after her lovers there, whose members were like those of donkeys, and whose issue was like that of horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus you longed for the lewdness of your youth, when the Egyptians handled your bosom and pressed your young breasts.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, O Oholibah, thus says the Lord God: “Behold, I will stir up against you your lovers from whom you turned in disgust, and I will bring them against you from every side:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, Pekod and Shoa and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them, desirable young men, governors and commanders all of them, officers and men of renown, all of them riding on horses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall come against you from the north with chariots and wagons and a host of peoples. They shall set themselves against you on every side with buckler, shield, and helmet; and I will commit the judgment to them, and they shall judge you according to their judgments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will direct my jealousy against you, that they may deal with you in fury. They shall cut off your nose and your ears, and your survivors shall fall by the sword. They shall seize your sons and your daughters, and your survivors shall be devoured by fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall also strip you of your clothes and take away your beautiful jewels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus I will put an end to your lewdness and your whoring begun in the land of Egypt, so that you shall not lift up your eyes to them or remember Egypt anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will deliver you into the hands of those whom you hate, into the hands of those from whom you turned in disgust,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they shall deal with you in hatred and take away all the fruit of your labor and leave you naked and bare, and the nakedness of your whoring shall be uncovered. Your lewdness and your whoring
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: have brought this upon you, because you played the whore with the nations and defiled yourself with their idols.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have gone the way of your sister; therefore I will give her cup into your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
you shall drink it and drain it out,
    and gnaw its shards,
    and tear your breasts;
for I have spoken, declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Because you have forgotten me and cast me behind your back, you yourself must bear the consequences of your lewdness and whoring.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Lord said to me: “Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Declare to them their abominations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have committed adultery, and blood is on their hands. With their idols they have committed adultery, and they have even offered up to them for food the children whom they had borne to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, this they have done to me: they have defiled my sanctuary on the same day and profaned my Sabbaths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when they had slaughtered their children in sacrifice to their idols, on the same day they came into my sanctuary to profane it. And behold, this is what they did in my house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They even sent for men to come from afar, to whom a messenger was sent; and behold, they came. For them you bathed yourself, painted your eyes, and adorned yourself with ornaments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You sat on a stately couch, with a table spread before it on which you had placed my incense and my oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sound of a carefree multitude was with her; and with men of the common sort, drunkards were brought from the wilderness; and they put bracelets on the hands of the women, and beautiful crowns on their heads.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then I said of her who was worn out by adultery, ‘Now they will continue to use her for a whore, even her!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they have gone in to her, as men go in to a prostitute. Thus they went in to Oholah and to Oholibah, lewd women!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But righteous men shall pass judgment on them with the sentence of adulteresses, and with the sentence of women who shed blood, because they are adulteresses, and blood is on their hands.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord God: “Bring up a vast host against them, and make them an object of terror and a plunder.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the host shall stone them and cut them down with their swords. They shall kill their sons and their daughters, and burn up their houses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus will I put an end to lewdness in the land, that all women may take warning and not commit lewdness as you have done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall return your lewdness upon you, and you shall bear the penalty for your sinful idolatry, and you shall know that I am the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the ninth year, in the tenth month, on the tenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, write down the name of this day, this very day. The king of Babylon has laid siege to Jerusalem this very day.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord God: Woe to the bloody city, to the pot whose corrosion is in it, and whose corrosion has not gone out of it! Take out of it piece after piece, without making any choice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the blood she has shed is in her midst; she put it on the bare rock; she did not pour it out on the ground to cover it with dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To rouse my wrath, to take vengeance, I have set on the bare rock the blood she has shed, that it may not be covered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Woe to the bloody city! I also will make the pile great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Heap on the logs, kindle the fire, boil the meat well, mix in the spices, and let the bones be burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then set it empty upon the coals, that it may become hot, and its copper may burn, that its uncleanness may be melted in it, its corrosion consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She has wearied herself with toil; its abundant corrosion does not go out of it. Into the fire with its corrosion!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On account of your unclean lewdness, because I would have cleansed you and you were not cleansed from your uncleanness, you shall not be cleansed anymore till I have satisfied my fury upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the Lord. I have spoken; it shall come to pass; I will do it. I will not go back; I will not spare; I will not relent; according to your ways and your deeds you will be judged, declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, behold, I am about to take the delight of your eyes away from you at a stroke; yet you shall not mourn or weep, nor shall your tears run down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Sigh, but not aloud; make no mourning for the dead. Bind on your turban, and put your shoes on your feet; do not cover your lips, nor eat the bread of men.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So I spoke to the people in the morning, and at evening my wife died. And on the next morning I did as I was commanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the people said to me, “Will you not tell us what these things mean for us, that you are acting thus?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I said to them, “The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: ‘Say to the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will profane my sanctuary, the pride of your power, the delight of your eyes, and the yearning of your soul, and your sons and your daughters whom you left behind shall fall by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you shall do as I have done; you shall not cover your lips, nor eat the bread of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your turbans shall be on your heads and your shoes on your feet; you shall not mourn or weep, but you shall rot away in your iniquities and groan to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus shall Ezekiel be to you a sign; according to all that he has done you shall do. When this comes, then you will know that I am the Lord God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, surely on the day when I take from them their stronghold, their joy and glory, the delight of their eyes and their soul's desire, and also their sons and daughters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: on that day a fugitive will come to you to report to you the news.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On that day your mouth will be opened to the fugitive, and you shall speak and be no longer mute. So you will be a sign to them, and they will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward the Ammonites and prophesy against them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to the Ammonites, Hear the word of the Lord God: Thus says the Lord God, Because you said, ‘Aha!’ over my sanctuary when it was profaned, and over the land of Israel when it was made desolate, and over the house of Judah when they went into exile,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore behold, I am handing you over to the people of the East for a possession, and they shall set their encampments among you and make their dwellings in your midst. They shall eat your fruit, and they shall drink your milk.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make Rabbah a pasture for camels and Ammon a fold for flocks. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For thus says the Lord God: Because you have clapped your hands and stamped your feet and rejoiced with all the malice within your soul against the land of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I have stretched out my hand against you, and will hand you over as plunder to the nations. And I will cut you off from the peoples and will make you perish out of the countries; I will destroy you. Then you will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God: Because Moab and Seir said, ‘Behold, the house of Judah is like all the other nations,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore I will lay open the flank of Moab from the cities, from its cities on its frontier, the glory of the country, Beth-jeshimoth, Baal-meon, and Kiriathaim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give it along with the Ammonites to the people of the East as a possession, that the Ammonites may be remembered no more among the nations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will execute judgments upon Moab. Then they will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God: Because Edom acted revengefully against the house of Judah and has grievously offended in taking vengeance on them,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord God, I will stretch out my hand against Edom and cut off from it man and beast. And I will make it desolate; from Teman even to Dedan they shall fall by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will lay my vengeance upon Edom by the hand of my people Israel, and they shall do in Edom according to my anger and according to my wrath, and they shall know my vengeance, declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God: Because the Philistines acted revengefully and took vengeance with malice of soul to destroy in never-ending enmity,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord God, Behold, I will stretch out my hand against the Philistines, and I will cut off the Cherethites and destroy the rest of the seacoast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will execute great vengeance on them with wrathful rebukes. Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I lay my vengeance upon them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, because Tyre said concerning Jerusalem, ‘Aha, the gate of the peoples is broken; it has swung open to me. I shall be replenished, now that she is laid waste,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against you, O Tyre, and will bring up many nations against you, as the sea brings up its waves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall destroy the walls of Tyre and break down her towers, and I will scrape her soil from her and make her a bare rock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She shall be in the midst of the sea a place for the spreading of nets, for I have spoken, declares the Lord God. And she shall become plunder for the nations,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and her daughters on the mainland shall be killed by the sword. Then they will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will bring against Tyre from the north Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, with horses and chariots, and with horsemen and a host of many soldiers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will kill with the sword your daughters on the mainland. He will set up a siege wall against you and throw up a mound against you, and raise a roof of shields against you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will direct the shock of his battering rams against your walls, and with his axes he will break down your towers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His horses will be so many that their dust will cover you. Your walls will shake at the noise of the horsemen and wagons and chariots, when he enters your gates as men enter a city that has been breached.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With the hoofs of his horses he will trample all your streets. He will kill your people with the sword, and your mighty pillars will fall to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will plunder your riches and loot your merchandise. They will break down your walls and destroy your pleasant houses. Your stones and timber and soil they will cast into the midst of the waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will stop the music of your songs, and the sound of your lyres shall be heard no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make you a bare rock. You shall be a place for the spreading of nets. You shall never be rebuilt, for I am the Lord; I have spoken, declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God to Tyre: Will not the coastlands shake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when slaughter is made in your midst?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then all the princes of the sea will step down from their thrones and remove their robes and strip off their embroidered garments. They will clothe themselves with trembling; they will sit on the ground and tremble every moment and be appalled at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they will raise a lamentation over you and say to you,
“‘How you have perished,
    you who were inhabited from the seas,
O city renowned,
    who was mighty on the sea;
she and her inhabitants imposed their terror
    on all her inhabitants!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now the coastlands tremble
    on the day of your fall,
and the coastlands that are on the sea
    are dismayed at your passing.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord God: When I make you a city laid waste, like the cities that are not inhabited, when I bring up the deep over you, and the great waters cover you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then I will make you go down with those who go down to the pit, to the people of old, and I will make you to dwell in the world below, among ruins from of old, with those who go down to the pit, so that you will not be inhabited; but I will set beauty in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will bring you to a dreadful end, and you shall be no more. Though you be sought for, you will never be found again, declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now you, son of man, raise a lamentation over Tyre,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say to Tyre, who dwells at the entrances to the sea, merchant of the peoples to many coastlands, thus says the Lord God:
“O Tyre, you have said,
    ‘I am perfect in beauty.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your borders are in the heart of the seas;
    your builders made perfect your beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They made all your planks
    of fir trees from Senir;
they took a cedar from Lebanon
    to make a mast for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Of fine embroidered linen from Egypt
    was your sail,
    serving as your banner;
blue and purple from the coasts of Elishah
    was your awning.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The elders of Gebal and her skilled men were in you,
    caulking your seams;
all the ships of the sea with their mariners were in you
    to barter for your wares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Persia and Lud and Put were in your army as your men of war. They hung the shield and helmet in you; they gave you splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Men of Arvad and Helech were on your walls all around, and men of Gamad were in your towers. They hung their shields on your walls all around; they made perfect your beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tarshish did business with you because of your great wealth of every kind; silver, iron, tin, and lead they exchanged for your wares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Javan, Tubal, and Meshech traded with you; they exchanged human beings and vessels of bronze for your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From Beth-togarmah they exchanged horses, war horses, and mules for your wares.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The men of Dedan traded with you. Many coastlands were your own special markets; they brought you in payment ivory tusks and ebony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Syria did business with you because of your abundant goods; they exchanged for your wares emeralds, purple, embroidered work, fine linen, coral, and ruby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judah and the land of Israel traded with you; they exchanged for your merchandise wheat of Minnith, meal, honey, oil, and balm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Damascus did business with you for your abundant goods, because of your great wealth of every kind; wine of Helbon and wool of Sahar
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and casks of wine from Uzal they exchanged for your wares; wrought iron, cassia, and calamus were bartered for your merchandise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dedan traded with you in saddlecloths for riding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Arabia and all the princes of Kedar were your favored dealers in lambs, rams, and goats; in these they did business with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The traders of Sheba and Raamah traded with you; they exchanged for your wares the best of all kinds of spices and all precious stones and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Haran, Canneh, Eden, traders of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad traded with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In your market these traded with you in choice garments, in clothes of blue and embroidered work, and in carpets of colored material, bound with cords and made secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The ships of Tarshish traveled for you with your merchandise. So you were filled and heavily laden in the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Your rowers have brought you out
    into the high seas.
The east wind has wrecked you
    in the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your riches, your wares, your merchandise,
    your mariners and your pilots,
your caulkers, your dealers in merchandise,
    and all your men of war who are in you,
with all your crew
    that is in your midst,
sink into the heart of the seas
    on the day of your fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At the sound of the cry of your pilots
    the countryside shakes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and down from their ships
    come all who handle the oar.
The mariners and all the pilots of the sea
    stand on the land
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and shout aloud over you
    and cry out bitterly.
They cast dust on their heads
    and wallow in ashes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they make themselves bald for you
    and put sackcloth on their waist,
and they weep over you in bitterness of soul,
    with bitter mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In their wailing they raise a lamentation for you
    and lament over you:
‘Who is like Tyre,
    like one destroyed in the midst of the sea?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When your wares came from the seas,
    you satisfied many peoples;
with your abundant wealth and merchandise
    you enriched the kings of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now you are wrecked by the seas,
    in the depths of the waters;
your merchandise and all your crew in your midst
    have sunk with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the inhabitants of the coastlands
    are appalled at you,
and the hair of their kings bristles with horror;
    their faces are convulsed.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, say to the prince of Tyre, Thus says the Lord God:
“Because your heart is proud,
    and you have said, ‘I am a god,
I sit in the seat of the gods,
    in the heart of the seas,’
yet you are but a man, and no god,
    though you make your heart like the heart of a god—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you are indeed wiser than Daniel;
    no secret is hidden from you;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by your wisdom and your understanding
    you have made wealth for yourself,
and have gathered gold and silver
    into your treasuries;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by your great wisdom in your trade
    you have increased your wealth,
    and your heart has become proud in your wealth—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore thus says the Lord God:
Because you make your heart
    like the heart of a god,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
therefore, behold, I will bring foreigners upon you,
    the most ruthless of the nations;
and they shall draw their swords against the beauty of your wisdom
    and defile your splendor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They shall thrust you down into the pit,
    and you shall die the death of the slain
    in the heart of the seas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will you still say, ‘I am a god,’
    in the presence of those who kill you,
though you are but a man, and no god,
    in the hands of those who slay you?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Moreover, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, raise a lamentation over the king of Tyre, and say to him, Thus says the Lord God:
“You were the signet of perfection,
    full of wisdom and perfect in beauty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You were in Eden, the garden of God;
    every precious stone was your covering,
sardius, topaz, and diamond,
    beryl, onyx, and jasper,
sapphire, emerald, and carbuncle;
    and crafted in gold were your settings
    and your engravings.
On the day that you were created
    they were prepared.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
In the abundance of your trade
    you were filled with violence in your midst, and you sinned;
so I cast you as a profane thing from the mountain of God,
    and I destroyed you, O guardian cherub,
    from the midst of the stones of fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
By the multitude of your iniquities,
    in the unrighteousness of your trade
    you profaned your sanctuaries;
so I brought fire out from your midst;
    it consumed you,
and I turned you to ashes on the earth
    in the sight of all who saw you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who know you among the peoples
    are appalled at you;
you have come to a dreadful end
    and shall be no more forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face toward Sidon, and prophesy against her
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say, Thus says the Lord God:
“Behold, I am against you, O Sidon,
    and I will manifest my glory in your midst.
And they shall know that I am the Lord
    when I execute judgments in her
    and manifest my holiness in her;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: “And for the house of Israel there shall be no more a brier to prick or a thorn to hurt them among all their neighbors who have treated them with contempt. Then they will know that I am the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God: When I gather the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and manifest my holiness in them in the sight of the nations, then they shall dwell in their own land that I gave to my servant Jacob.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they shall dwell securely in it, and they shall build houses and plant vineyards. They shall dwell securely, when I execute judgments upon all their neighbors who have treated them with contempt. Then they will know that I am the Lord their God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the tenth year, in the tenth month, on the twelfth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, set your face against Pharaoh king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
speak, and say, Thus says the Lord God:
“Behold, I am against you,
    Pharaoh king of Egypt,
the great dragon that lies
    in the midst of his streams,
that says, ‘My Nile is my own;
    I made it for myself.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will put hooks in your jaws,
    and make the fish of your streams stick to your scales;
and I will draw you up out of the midst of your streams,
    with all the fish of your streams
    that stick to your scales.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will cast you out into the wilderness,
    you and all the fish of your streams;
you shall fall on the open field,
    and not be brought together or gathered.
To the beasts of the earth and to the birds of the heavens
    I give you as food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the Lord.
“Because you have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when they grasped you with the hand, you broke and tore all their shoulders; and when they leaned on you, you broke and made all their loins to shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will bring a sword upon you, and will cut off from you man and beast,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and the land of Egypt shall be a desolation and a waste. Then they will know that I am the Lord.
“Because you said, ‘The Nile is mine, and I made it,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, behold, I am against you and against your streams, and I will make the land of Egypt an utter waste and desolation, from Migdol to Syene, as far as the border of Cush.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No foot of man shall pass through it, and no foot of beast shall pass through it; it shall be uninhabited forty years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make the land of Egypt a desolation in the midst of desolated countries, and her cities shall be a desolation forty years among cities that are laid waste. I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations, and disperse them through the countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord God: At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from the peoples among whom they were scattered,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I will restore the fortunes of Egypt and bring them back to the land of Pathros, the land of their origin, and there they shall be a lowly kingdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It shall be the most lowly of the kingdoms, and never again exalt itself above the nations. And I will make them so small that they will never again rule over the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall never again be the reliance of the house of Israel, recalling their iniquity, when they turn to them for aid. Then they will know that I am the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twenty-seventh year, in the first month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made his army labor hard against Tyre. Every head was made bald, and every shoulder was rubbed bare, yet neither he nor his army got anything from Tyre to pay for the labor that he had performed against her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will give the land of Egypt to Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and he shall carry off its wealth and despoil it and plunder it; and it shall be the wages for his army.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given him the land of Egypt as his payment for which he labored, because they worked for me, declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On that day I will cause a horn to spring up for the house of Israel, and I will open your lips among them. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus says the Lord God:
“Wail, ‘Alas for the day!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the day is near,
    the day of the Lord is near;
it will be a day of clouds,
    a time of doom for the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sword shall come upon Egypt,
    and anguish shall be in Cush,
when the slain fall in Egypt,
    and her wealth is carried away,
    and her foundations are torn down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Cush, and Put, and Lud, and all Arabia, and Libya, and the people of the land that is in league, shall fall with them by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord:
Those who support Egypt shall fall,
    and her proud might shall come down;
from Migdol to Syene
    they shall fall within her by the sword,
declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they shall be desolated in the midst of desolated countries,
    and their cities shall be in the midst of cities that are laid waste.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then they will know that I am the Lord,
    when I have set fire to Egypt,
    and all her helpers are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “On that day messengers shall go out from me in ships to terrify the unsuspecting people of Cush, and anguish shall come upon them on the day of Egypt's doom; for, behold, it comes!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Thus says the Lord God:
“I will put an end to the wealth of Egypt,
    by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He and his people with him, the most ruthless of nations,
    shall be brought in to destroy the land,
and they shall draw their swords against Egypt
    and fill the land with the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will make Pathros a desolation
    and will set fire to Zoan
    and will execute judgments on Thebes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will pour out my wrath on Pelusium,
    the stronghold of Egypt,
    and cut off the multitude of Thebes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The young men of On and of Pi-beseth shall fall by the sword,
    and the women shall go into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At Tehaphnehes the day shall be dark,
    when I break there the yoke bars of Egypt,
and her proud might shall come to an end in her;
    she shall be covered by a cloud,
    and her daughters shall go into captivity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus I will execute judgments on Egypt.
    Then they will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and behold, it has not been bound up, to heal it by binding it with a bandage, so that it may become strong to wield the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt and will break his arms, both the strong arm and the one that was broken, and I will make the sword fall from his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them through the countries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put my sword in his hand, but I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before him like a man mortally wounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, but the arms of Pharaoh shall fall. Then they shall know that I am the Lord, when I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon and he stretches it out against the land of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries. Then they will know that I am the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the eleventh year, in the third month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his multitude:
“Whom are you like in your greatness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon,
with beautiful branches and forest shade,
    and of towering height,
    its top among the clouds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters nourished it;
    the deep made it grow tall,
making its rivers flow
    around the place of its planting,
sending forth its streams
    to all the trees of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So it towered high
    above all the trees of the field;
its boughs grew large
    and its branches long
    from abundant water in its shoots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the birds of the heavens
    made their nests in its boughs;
under its branches all the beasts of the field
    gave birth to their young,
and under its shadow
    lived all great nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It was beautiful in its greatness,
    in the length of its branches;
for its roots went down
    to abundant waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I made it beautiful
    in the mass of its branches,
and all the trees of Eden envied it,
    that were in the garden of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore thus says the Lord God: Because it towered high and set its top among the clouds, and its heart was proud of its height,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will give it into the hand of a mighty one of the nations. He shall surely deal with it as its wickedness deserves. I have cast it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Foreigners, the most ruthless of nations, have cut it down and left it. On the mountains and in all the valleys its branches have fallen, and its boughs have been broken in all the ravines of the land, and all the peoples of the earth have gone away from its shadow and left it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On its fallen trunk dwell all the birds of the heavens, and on its branches are all the beasts of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this is in order that no trees by the waters may grow to towering height or set their tops among the clouds, and that no trees that drink water may reach up to them in height. For they are all given over to death, to the world below, among the children of man, with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Thus says the Lord God: On the day the cedar went down to Sheol I caused mourning; I closed the deep over it, and restrained its rivers, and many waters were stopped. I clothed Lebanon in gloom for it, and all the trees of the field fainted because of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made the nations quake at the sound of its fall, when I cast it down to Sheol with those who go down to the pit. And all the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, were comforted in the world below.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They also went down to Sheol with it, to those who are slain by the sword; yes, those who were its arm, who lived under its shadow among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whom are you thus like in glory and in greatness among the trees of Eden? You shall be brought down with the trees of Eden to the world below. You shall lie among the uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword.
“This is Pharaoh and all his multitude, declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the first day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Son of man, raise a lamentation over Pharaoh king of Egypt and say to him:
“You consider yourself a lion of the nations,
    but you are like a dragon in the seas;
you burst forth in your rivers,
    trouble the waters with your feet,
    and foul their rivers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thus says the Lord God:
    I will throw my net over you
    with a host of many peoples,
    and they will haul you up in my dragnet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I will cast you on the ground;
    on the open field I will fling you,
and will cause all the birds of the heavens to settle on you,
    and I will gorge the beasts of the whole earth with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will strew your flesh upon the mountains
    and fill the valleys with your carcass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will drench the land even to the mountains
    with your flowing blood,
    and the ravines will be full of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I blot you out, I will cover the heavens
    and make their stars dark;
I will cover the sun with a cloud,
    and the moon shall not give its light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the bright lights of heaven
    will I make dark over you,
    and put darkness on your land,
declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will trouble the hearts of many peoples, when I bring your destruction among the nations, into the countries that you have not known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will make many peoples appalled at you, and the hair of their kings shall bristle with horror because of you, when I brandish my sword before them. They shall tremble every moment, every one for his own life, on the day of your downfall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord God: The sword of the king of Babylon shall come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will cause your multitude to fall by the swords of mighty ones, all of them most ruthless of nations.
“They shall bring to ruin the pride of Egypt,
    and all its multitude shall perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will destroy all its beasts
    from beside many waters;
and no foot of man shall trouble them anymore,
    nor shall the hoofs of beasts trouble them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I will make their waters clear,
    and cause their rivers to run like oil,
declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I make the land of Egypt desolate,
    and when the land is desolate of all that fills it,
when I strike down all who dwell in it,
    then they will know that I am the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is a lamentation that shall be chanted; the daughters of the nations shall chant it; over Egypt, and over all her multitude, shall they chant it, declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, on the fifteenth day of the month, the word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, wail over the multitude of Egypt, and send them down, her and the daughters of majestic nations, to the world below, to those who have gone down to the pit:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
‘Whom do you surpass in beauty?
    Go down and be laid to rest with the uncircumcised.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They shall fall amid those who are slain by the sword. Egypt is delivered to the sword; drag her away, and all her multitudes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The mighty chiefs shall speak of them, with their helpers, out of the midst of Sheol: ‘They have come down, they lie still, the uncircumcised, slain by the sword.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Assyria is there, and all her company, its graves all around it, all of them slain, fallen by the sword,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whose graves are set in the uttermost parts of the pit; and her company is all around her grave, all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who spread terror in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Elam is there, and all her multitude around her grave; all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who went down uncircumcised into the world below, who spread their terror in the land of the living; and they bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They have made her a bed among the slain with all her multitude, her graves all around it, all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; for terror of them was spread in the land of the living, and they bear their shame with those who go down to the pit; they are placed among the slain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Meshech-Tubal is there, and all her multitude, her graves all around it, all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; for they spread their terror in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they do not lie with the mighty, the fallen from among the uncircumcised, who went down to Sheol with their weapons of war, whose swords were laid under their heads, and whose iniquities are upon their bones; for the terror of the mighty men was in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, you shall be broken and lie among the uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Edom is there, her kings and all her princes, who for all their might are laid with those who are killed by the sword; they lie with the uncircumcised, with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The princes of the north are there, all of them, and all the Sidonians, who have gone down in shame with the slain, for all the terror that they caused by their might; they lie uncircumcised with those who are slain by the sword, and bear their shame with those who go down to the pit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “When Pharaoh sees them, he will be comforted for all his multitude, Pharaoh and all his army, slain by the sword, declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I spread terror in the land of the living; and he shall be laid to rest among the uncircumcised, with those who are slain by the sword, Pharaoh and all his multitude, declares the Lord God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, speak to your people and say to them, If I bring the sword upon a land, and the people of the land take a man from among them, and make him their watchman,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and if he sees the sword coming upon the land and blows the trumpet and warns the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: then if anyone who hears the sound of the trumpet does not take warning, and the sword comes and takes him away, his blood shall be upon his own head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He heard the sound of the trumpet and did not take warning; his blood shall be upon himself. But if he had taken warning, he would have saved his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if the watchman sees the sword coming and does not blow the trumpet, so that the people are not warned, and the sword comes and takes any one of them, that person is taken away in his iniquity, but his blood I will require at the watchman's hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “So you, son of man, I have made a watchman for the house of Israel. Whenever you hear a word from my mouth, you shall give them warning from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I say to the wicked, O wicked one, you shall surely die, and you do not speak to warn the wicked to turn from his way, that wicked person shall die in his iniquity, but his blood I will require at your hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you warn the wicked to turn from his way, and he does not turn from his way, that person shall die in his iniquity, but you will have delivered your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, say to the house of Israel, Thus have you said: ‘Surely our transgressions and our sins are upon us, and we rot away because of them. How then can we live?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say to them, As I live, declares the Lord God, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but that the wicked turn from his way and live; turn back, turn back from your evil ways, for why will you die, O house of Israel?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And you, son of man, say to your people, The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver him when he transgresses, and as for the wickedness of the wicked, he shall not fall by it when he turns from his wickedness, and the righteous shall not be able to live by his righteousness when he sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though I say to the righteous that he shall surely live, yet if he trusts in his righteousness and does injustice, none of his righteous deeds shall be remembered, but in his injustice that he has done he shall die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again, though I say to the wicked, ‘You shall surely die,’ yet if he turns from his sin and does what is just and right,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: if the wicked restores the pledge, gives back what he has taken by robbery, and walks in the statutes of life, not doing injustice, he shall surely live; he shall not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the sins that he has committed shall be remembered against him. He has done what is just and right; he shall surely live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet your people say, ‘The way of the Lord is not just,’ when it is their own way that is not just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the righteous turns from his righteousness and does injustice, he shall die for it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when the wicked turns from his wickedness and does what is just and right, he shall live by this.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you say, ‘The way of the Lord is not just.’ O house of Israel, I will judge each of you according to his ways.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the twelfth year of our exile, in the tenth month, on the fifth day of the month, a fugitive from Jerusalem came to me and said, “The city has been struck down.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the hand of the Lord had been upon me the evening before the fugitive came; and he had opened my mouth by the time the man came to me in the morning, so my mouth was opened, and I was no longer mute.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, the inhabitants of these waste places in the land of Israel keep saying, ‘Abraham was only one man, yet he got possession of the land; but we are many; the land is surely given us to possess.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore say to them, Thus says the Lord God: You eat flesh with the blood and lift up your eyes to your idols and shed blood; shall you then possess the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You rely on the sword, you commit abominations, and each of you defiles his neighbor's wife; shall you then possess the land?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Say this to them, Thus says the Lord God: As I live, surely those who are in the waste places shall fall by the sword, and whoever is in the open field I will give to the beasts to be devoured, and those who are in strongholds and in caves shall die by pestilence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will make the land a desolation and a waste, and her proud might shall come to an end, and the mountains of Israel shall be so desolate that none will pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they will know that I am the Lord, when I have made the land a desolation and a waste because of all their abominations that they have committed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “As for you, son of man, your people who talk together about you by the walls and at the doors of the houses, say to one another, each to his brother, ‘Come, and hear what the word is that comes from the Lord.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And they come to you as people come, and they sit before you as my people, and they hear what you say but they will not do it; for with lustful talk in their mouths they act; their heart is set on their gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And behold, you are to them like one who sings lustful songs with a beautiful voice and plays well on an instrument, for they hear what you say, but they will not do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When this comes—and come it will!—then they will know that a prophet has been among them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The word of the Lord came to me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel; prophesy, and say to them, even to the shepherds, Thus says the Lord God: Ah, shepherds of Israel who have been feeding yourselves! Should not shepherds feed the sheep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You eat the fat, you clothe yourselves with the wool, you slaughter the fat ones, but you do not feed the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The weak you have not strengthened, the sick you have not healed, the injured you have not bound up, the strayed you have not brought back, the lost you have not sought, and with force and harshness you have ruled them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they were scattered, because there was no shepherd, and they became food for all the wild beasts. My sheep were scattered;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: they wandered over all the mountains and on every high hill. My sheep were scattered over all the face of the earth, with none to search or seek for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As I live, declares the Lord God, surely because my sheep have become a prey, and my sheep have become food for all the wild beasts, since there was no shepherd, and because my shepherds have not searched for my sheep, but the shepherds have fed themselves, and have not fed my sheep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: therefore, you shepherds, hear the word of the Lord:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus says the Lord God, Behold, I am against the shepherds, and I will require my sheep at their hand and put a stop to their feeding the sheep. No longer shall the shepherds feed themselves. I will rescue my sheep from their mouths, that they may not be food for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For thus says the Lord God: Behold, I, I myself will search for my sheep and will seek them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a shepherd seeks out his flock when he is among his sheep that have been scattered, so will I seek out my sheep, and I will rescue them from all places where they have been scattered on a day of clouds and thick darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will bring them out from the peoples and gather them from the countries, and will bring them into their own land. And I will feed them on the mountains of Israel, by the ravines, and in all the inhabited places of the country.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will feed them with good pasture, and on the mountain heights of Israel shall be their grazing land. There they shall lie down in good grazing land, and on rich pasture they shall feed on the mountains of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I myself will be the shepherd of my sheep, and I myself will make them lie down, declares the Lord God.
verses.speaker: Narrator
